page.title: 08LIVESTOCK IN GERRICK AREA
page.content: DAIRY COWS. 4 farms have dairy herds composed of 94% Friesian and 6% Jersey. Milk is collected by bulk tanker daily. BEEF CATTLE. 6 farms have suckler herds (including 1 Pedigree Hereford Herd founded in 1963 with 2 cows and 1 bull). The herd is named FREEBOROUGH The cows used for breeding beef calves are Friesian or Aberdeen Angus crossed with :- e.g. Charolais, Limousin, Galloway or Hereford. BULLS. 3 in the area, 1 jointly owned. Breeds :- 1 Charolais, 1 Hereford, 1 Limousin. SHEEP. 3 farms carry sheep. There are mainly Scotch Blackface but some Swaledale, Blue-faced Leicester and Mules. 1 farm has the grazing of about 3000 acres of moorland which supports 600 breeding ewes. There is an average of 70% live births/year.
